Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2008 07:04PM wetcoast wrote: Hi Eileen,  I finished dd ac and then taxol May 22/08. During chemo I had a little tingling in my hands and feet but nothing really serious. Because I had a low wbc I was using neupogen and I could not tell if my muscle and joint pain was from taxol or neupogen. Since completion of chemo my hands feel as though I was hammering nails for 8 hours. My fingers and hands are stiff and ache daily. Upon waking and getting out of bed my feet feel as though they are slapping on the floor and in the heel area it is as though the tendons and ligaments are tight and need to be stretched out. My legs and feet ache usually upon getting up from a seated position. Any one out there who knows how long this will go on? laurel

Posts.Content: May 30, 2008 06:43PM wetcoast wrote: Hi yogi, I did dose dense ac and then taxol. I did the neupogen shots  (7 to 8 ) starting 2 days after 1st, 2nd, 3rd counts were good going into 4th so nothing and then I started taxol and they figured wbc would be ok. After 1st taxol (5th) I ended doing a shot of neulasta because I would have needed at least 9 shots and I was going away. Going into 6th I was good and after the 7th taxol I ended up doing 7 neupogen shots again. The injections were all at 480cc I believe as my counts were always quite low. I had blood tests the day prior to chemo and they determined if and how many injections I would need. Both are very expensive. I hate needles so my hubby was the doctor and we did the injections in the evening about an 1 hour to 2 before bed. I found the neupogen shots easier to deal with as far as aches and pains and took ibuprofen if needed. My hips, back, and sternum got aches when the bone marrow was working. Nothing really bad. However, when I got the neulasta the same spots ached but sometimes it was a pain that would envelope me and I would stop in my tracks. I never got any colds, flu's etc and did not have to postpone any treatments. Hope I could help you out tc laurel

Posts.Title: Eviction jadatemple crazydaisy

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2008 02:42AM wetcoast wrote: Hi Ruth, I did not have a port but had an iv extravasition in my arm. It was the 7th treatment of dose dense ac and then taxol. I was on the taxol portion. They were having trouble finding a vein and ended up using the back side of my arm (between wrist and elbow). The cannula inserted without any problem and was into the infusion at 3 hours. The nurses were very good about checking and constantly going around the room monitoring. The longest was probably 10 minutes without someone looking at it. I got up to go to the washroom and looked at my arm and from mid bicep to about 3 inches above my wrist my arm was probably 3x the size it should have been. It was not itchy and I didn't feel any discomfort. The nurse calmly turned the pump off and said go to the washroom and we will fix it when you come back. Of course when I came back the big books were on their desk and their faces were anything but calm. They removed the iv and used my other arm for the remainder of the treatment. (I know I  know ) Ice was put on right away for as long as I could stand it and continued to do that for about a week. The pain was excruciating from the swelling and the heat and I could not put any pressure on the arm. I had 4 lesions about the size of  a 25 cent piece and they kept peeling ( though I had been burn't  on a hot oven). My arm gradually decreased to a normal size over 8 weeks. During those weeks the pain, burning, itching was off the charts. I took benedryl for the itching and used cortizone cream for topical. Was also taking decadron for allergic reactions to chemo.  My skin turned dark red (almost like a birth mark) and was like really rough sand paper for ages. Not a fun situation in an already crappy one. If you have any question don't hesitate to send me a private message. I was fortunate it was taxol and not the ac portion I was told.
Posts.Title: Serious Chemo Complication ruth599 ruth599

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2008 01:36AM - edited Mar 14, 2008 01:37AM by wetcoast They are calling my treatment dose dense and it is done every two weeks. Am doing ac x 4 and then taxol x 4. I just did the 3rd ac yesterday. The day before my tx I have blood work done to determine my white cells and then starting 48 hrs after tx my hubby commences nightly shots of neupogen. This round I get 8 shots. yuk. Total time line is 16 weeks for me unless infections ect pop up. So far so good. tc and sorry to see you back

After my second ac (4 ac x 2) it started falling out constantly and I could read the paper and it was covered or the keyboard. I am now patchy stubble and it is still falling out. I noticed at about day 3 my roots would hurt and the fall out would increase. I did find a great weapon though. 3mm lint brush with the sticky sheets. Just roll back and forth. I thought I heard someone say benedryl or clariton help. Any one know. hugs and smiles for everyone

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2008 10:45AM wetcoast wrote: Goodmorning everyone, tx4 done and no more ac.  I now know what dragging my 'ss around is. I went for an hour run the first day after tx and since then my energy level is non existent. I tried to run yesterday and managed to squeek out about 12km and with the hail, rain, snow, sleet and me being a wimp I called my hubby to come and get me. Went out for lunch instead. Pond frogs, sorry you've joined us. I also have ativan and usually, not always, take it about an hour before bed. I am an axious person as well and have some of the heart burn you are talking about. The ativan takes care of both. I have tried scimping or suffering but it the long run it is not worth it. I am told because I am not taking it all day every day not to be concerned about addiction. I was having a little bit of lower back pain as well and guess what it was. Dumb dumb dumb. Septic was plugged up some what. Not gonna happen again. My son and his girlfriend just announced they were going to get married next year. She is a great girl for a super son. She is going to start school to become a natural path. Could use her now. Grand babies would be exciting but I have time to wait. congrats donna Taxol is my new drug of choice next time around anybody have any tips on how to deal with this little monster? Well it is a sunny day here in Bella vista, after the whatever yesterday, Artsee you would have a view to paint here. Orchards and vineyards. Everyone tc and smile 4 down 4 to go. laurel

Wonder what the difference is? I had been using neupogen prior to first tx of ac and then every one but the last one. Usually 8 shots each cycle. Thought it was kind of odd because you know ac kicks the crap out of the little guys. They are the drs though. This time neulasta is my potion. How did things go aurora?
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2008 10:35AM - edited Apr 13, 2008 10:40AM by wetcoast Hi girls, No trouble with tornado's or bad weather in my neck of the woods. Mowed my lawn for the second time of the season and temps hit 72. I am sure there are girls out there that would just love to bop me for that comment. Artsee, I will try and figure out how to load a picture and send some. My apricot tree  has begun to bloom with many others plants budding as well. Can't wait for all the new smells. Went for a walk above our house over looking the valley and lots of cows with their white faced babies running around and millions of butter cups and violets. Donna lee, Nobleanna,Grannie Rose,   went for my first tx of taxol on friday with my sister and dx. Good thing they both went because they were company for each other. I would say I slept through most of the session. Which was alright. I don't have a port so the nurse tried 3 times to stick me (he was cute and very apologetic.). It is still a little sore and bruised today. I took an ativan before I got there and then kytril once I got in the chair.The injections of zanax, steroids and benedryl took about 45 minutes. Then came the special sauce. By then I was fighting to keep my eyes open. Didn't have any reactions what so ever. So started everything about 9 and was out by 2. A little wired at bedtime (10) and was told to take an ativan and slept until 7:30 am. I am taking dexamyathose 4 mg with breakfast and supper for 3 days post chemo. So tuesday with be in the dumps. My hubby didn't think I looked that great in the am  so said no running but we went for a walk. I took my neulast shot a 2 pm and so far just have a little soreness but nothing to warrent any drugs. For me I have still needed the stool stuff because of the kytil and am drinking lots of water. But over all just feeling tired and fingers a little puffy. Pam, you have to keep those nurses on there toes with a sense of humor but sometimes they just don't get it. I wore some scrubs and mouth mask on friday and asked which wanted to be my patient. No takers. Think of it now maybe that's why they couldn't find a vein. Aurora and Chris, I am looking forward to the day when I can say that was my last tx. I am sure we all are. For all of you I've missed, wishing you laughter and smiles take care , laurel

Posts.Content: May 23, 2008 11:28PM wetcoast wrote: my last chemo is done///I guess doing dose dense gets you through quicker than ever three weeks. I am definitely pooped though. My arm that I had the extravasation on is coming along. It still feels bruised and the skin is peeling now but at least the itching has stopped and the swelling has gone down for the most part. They used my lumpectamy arm yesterday but so far everything has been fine. They didn't want to risk the other arm  after what happened the last time. Radiation will be 4 weeks from now so that puts me the middle of june sometime. I will have an hour drive each way for that little zap. I had plans of staying a couple of nights with my son and his fiance but they have bought a townhouse in Vernon (where I live) and they will be packing boxes. My nick name is now peach (due to the peach fuzz on my head) and no longer cue ball as my hubby duly named me. Does the fuzz stay or turn into real hair or it that it? I was hoping for the thick mop of unruly hair like Hillary. Oh well hair is hair. Before you know it most of us will be meeting again in the June rads gang. I just know I couldn't have done the chemo without all of you and really appreciated all the thoughts, prayers, chuckles and tears along the way. It was a great way to start or finish the day and look forward to keeping in touch. Be strong, laugh, love  and live like there is no tomorrow hugs laurel

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2008 07:18AM wetcoast wrote: nobleanna, I love your name it resinates strength for me for whatever reason. The neulasta shot is an injection that some girls get a day after their chemo to increase white cell count to ward off infections. I take a neupojen injection for 7 days following my chemo (today on day 7 ) which is something along the same lines. I have lab tests the day prior to chemo and that is when onc determines how many days of neupojen I need. 40something, my hubby buzzed my hair yesterday and I did his and we both laughed. He looks like a pin head and just like I thought I'm all eyes and nose.  My waterworks seems to have a mind of its own crying at the most ridiculous things. One of them is I am 48 and never woken up during the night to pee even when I was pregnant. Never. Now I wake up at least 2x. I cry over that....All this talk of water reminds me to all fab feb girls starting tx drink water.  hugs and smiles to everyone  and take care laurel

Tonight is the last one until next round. yippee

At the base of my neck to where my vertabrae bumps start to just above between shoulder blades on different days has been really sore. Almost like I have slept with too many pillows. I was going to ask onc next week when I see him. I had my chemo on the 12th and am still dizzy at times but have low bp. I took the anti nausea meds as instructed and didn't have any problems but my stomach definitely has it's little quirks and seems to feel queasy quite easy. It is not fun but we can do it together. There is a wealth of information here so don't hesitate to ask. I am taking neupogen shots for 7 days which I think is along the neulasta line and was told that my chest and sternum area could be sore from the increase production of white cells. maybe. take care laurel

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2008 11:46AM - edited Mar 5, 2008 11:48AM by wetcoast Good morning everyone, It is a beautiful morning in sunny bella vista no wet coast here. Went to the radiation onc yesterday and am so excited. Sometimes it pays to be a member of the itty bitty t*tty club. Because I am so small I will only need 16 tx opposed to the original 30. It is good all around because it is an hour drive each way. Yahoo Susan,  I have always worked full time as my hubby is disabled, born and raised on a farm, middle child and have never been much of a lolly gaggler. Although I don't have the energy I normally do I still make myself wash cupboards and do things around the house along with my runs and eliptical. I find I do feel better once I get going and I think it helps me sleep better at night even if it is broken up. I have had 2 ac tx and found with each that I have less energy but am the little engine that can. Chris, I do hope things have worked themself out!! crazypam, wondered if a little sports drink for electrolytes would help. Hope you are feeling better. Bridget, whatever it takes to get you through the day laughter and smiles laurel

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2008 09:31PM - edited Feb 1, 2008 09:32PM by wetcoast well it is official I am joining the Feb girls. My oncologist was great and explained ever detail so that I understood everything on how he arrived at his recommendations. He had even got a second opinion out of vancouver before I met with him which was something I was going to do.  Looks like it will be ac every 2 weeks starting feb 12 for 4 cycle and then taxol every 2 weeks for 4 more.  Will have  shots of neupogen throughout as well. Then 3 weeks holiday and onto 6 weeks of rads. Can hardly wait. (no sarcasm here) Ask me now I feel about needles? He said they could put a picc in place but no port option. Suck it up girl. I go for a muga and scan next week and already have the blood work done. Chemo school is next week as well and I guess that is when I ask all the can I still questions. I am just relieved to finally have some plans in place. My son is the most upset of all about the chemo. I guess he figures if chemo is involved it makes it more serious. He asked if I was getting a wig and to be quite honest I don't want one. Hat or scarf route for me I think.  here goes girls we can do this...

Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: May 14, 2008 10:39PM wetcoast wrote: Hi everyone, Extravasation is the word of the week. Or that is the term they are using when chemo (in this case taxol) leaked into the tissue of my arm. There could be different reasons why it did that from the cannula poking through my vein farther down from entry point, to damaged veins, to a faulty cannula. They are always very cautious and checked every ten minutes during chemo but there it was. The onc says she has never seen it happen in the 10 years she been in the cancer clinic. My arm from elbow front and back to about three inches above the wrist tripled in size on the weekend with the swelling residing quite a bit now, but it goes from flaming red burning skin to insanely itching. You cannot really scratch because the skin is so sensitive and feeling bruised. Today is the first day I can lean my arm on a arm chair. There are dark spots about the size of a dime and am told they will probably blister. They said it could take weeks to settle down. So girls beware if you have your chemo via iv(cannula) and the alarm goes off on the pump, you feel anything odd like burning and itching holler asap. I have been going to the clinic everyday to ensure there is no infection. My last taxol they are talking about using my mast arm. Which scares me to death by the way. I am so ready to be done with this// laurel

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2008 11:22AM wetcoast wrote: Morning girls, The anti nausea meds I take are Kytril, 2 pills 30 min before  tx and one the next morning with dexamethsone 2 pills 30 min before and the 1 4-6 hrs later. I have maxeran and ativan to use ever 6 hrs if required. I am now on my 4th ac treatment thursday and have only used the later on my first tx one time. I had a little queesy tummy the first tx but nothing since. Although it has not been easy I have been fortunate and do feel guilty reading how rough some of you have it. My complaints are the sore  mouth and am using the biotene mouthwash and baking soda. The baking soda has worked the best but everything is beginning to taste like bs. I have also needed lots of neupogen with the last round 8 shots. Although it is expensive it is not as bad as in the US. I asked for neulasta but the pharmacies don't carry it and have to order it in.The needles are tough for me and I would rather work 8 hours than get one. wha wha wha Sleep also is my friend these days  and can't seem to get enough of it. nobleanna, I hope things are picking up for you and the nasty infection is taking a back seat and soon to be kicked to the curb. artsee, you are one talented lady. For all you tx girls today wishing an easy road for you. laurel
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2008 11:21AM - edited Mar 27, 2008 11:21AM by wetcoast Morning all, Today is the last round of ac and my white counts were great so no neupogen this time. Best birthday present I could have got. Taxol is next. Donna lee, if you are iron defficient try dried apricot, molasses, folate rich foods like legumes and fortified cereal, nuts and seeds, dark leafy veg except spinich. Try to incorporate vit c foods at same time as they help in the absorption on iron. Use cast iron frying pans for cooking. foods to avoid are rhubard, spinach, chard, beets, chives, parsley and chocolate as they are high in oxalic acid which inhibits iron absorbtion. I have had trouble with anemia for years and since i was dx my iron has maintained the best ever. Go figure. Also my throat feels raw and when I run especially have tons of mucos. I asked the onc and she said it is one of those quick growing cells that are affected along with the hair etc with the chemo. I have had it for 2 tx now and I never get a cold just scratchy throat and runny nose I have eye lashes and eye brows but not much else. I went topless for the first time yesterday. (I forgot my hat) Got a few of those pathetic looks that drive me nuts. Well here goes and ac is done. Yippee. Half way there. Hope everyone has a wonderful day and are a little closer to spring. Wishing you well laurel

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2008 09:56AM wetcoast wrote: Hi Girls, I'm still with you just took a little break for my Boston marathon trip. Which was awesome. I am however exhausted and have lots of relaxing to catch up on. Got home wednsday night and so thursday was labs and dr's appointments. Friday was my second taxol. My white cells are up but now red and platlets and all that is down. Might get some extra juice if it keeps going down. Didn't sleep much last night thats for sure. They let me cut my decadron pills in half this round so we will see what happens. Last time I could not sleep worth anything. Even got sleeping pills that didn't really help. Two more to go then rads. (i am so ready for this to be over as all of us are) How long are you girls waiting between chemo and rads and when did you start asking about follow ups Grannie, my tears come at the weirdest times. Here I am on my trip to boston just getting ready to sit down in the cheers pub with my friends and I start bawling. Go figure. Nothing had happened and there I go. It did pass but off course everyone hits the panic button. We are all almost there so be strong, smile, laugh and take one step at a time. hugs laurel

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2008 12:26AM - edited Feb 15, 2008 12:32AM by wetcoast Hi valentine girls, I had my first ac treatment on tuesday and it took about two hours. I had two tablets of kytril half hour before iv and two the next morning plus 2 dexamethasone half hour before iv and 1 six hours later. I have taken 1 ativan since and 1 metoclopramide since. Tummy a little rumbly once in awhile and that is it for upset. Definitely used stool softners or that would be something else. My head has  been fuzzy or a little dizzy with small headache this morning, kind of like a flu bug. I have been drinking lots of fluids, soups and solid foods and even went for an hour run yesterday. I stopped by the hospital to pick up the neupogen yesterday and was scared to death I may drop it. My dh gave me my first  shot today and what a scary experience that was. He's always wanted to play doctor though// Well as I am a runner I am at 3 and a 1/4 miles into this journey with 23 and 1/2 more to go. Just a few more hills. Take care everyone

We are almost there// hope all is well with everyone laurel

Posts.Content: May 9, 2008 11:15PM wetcoast wrote: had my 3rd taxol, what a zoo. I don't have a port so they are working with my right arm. After two tries they finally get a vein in the bottom of arm between wrist and elbow. Really painful. The nurses checked every 10 min like usual and my alarm went off and they came right back and checked again. About 15 miniute later I got up to go to the washroom and the nurse was going by and sound how long has your arm been like that, I looked down and it was swollen from mid arm to elbow all the way around. She stopped it right away, and I went to the washroom and went and sat down down again. She finally came back and after consultations with the head nurse they decided to go to my no  no arm. Second try got a vein and was finished in 35 min. They have never seen a needle do this and so I have about 50 ml's of pacitaxol in my arm tissue. They put ice on it right away and I have been doing this at home as well. they said no heat and not to use it.  My arm feels like it is swollen and about to pop. It feels very bruised although no discolor and my elbow aches. Has anyone had this happen to them and what was the outcome. i am to go back on monday and have it checked again but for right now am concerned about having chemical eating away at muscle tissue. Any info would be greatly appreciated. My wbc is in the toilet again as well so nepoguen is in my future again with 7 shots starting sunday. Hope everyone has a sweet weekend hugs laurel
